tasks.title: Create an 'Agent Manager' page within this dashboard app
tasks.description: We need a separate page for managing agents. Within this page, we should have cards for each of the different agent subtypes that we've created, and within those cards, we should be able to see the prompt that we've created to use with that agent going forward. This might have to pull from agents.md; I'm not sure exactly how OpenClause sets it up. But also within this page, we should have a "Create an Agent" button. Within that view, a user should be able to drop files, write text, input whatever else, decide on specific model types from a drop-down menu, and make any kind of determinations necessary for how you might set up a sub-agent going forward. The idea will be these kinds of agent profiles will exist in perpetuity on the machine, and whenever I create a task, I can assign it an agent profile from this page. So a coding agent that I've decided uses codecs and follows certain development protocols will be implemented for any task that I decide. Same for UI agent, or whatever other kind of working type of agent that I'd like to add.

tasks.title: Create an 'Agent Manager' page within the Kanban Dashboard
tasks.description: Use Codex5.2 for executing after plan has been created. We need a separate page for managing agents. Within this page, we should have cards for each of the different agent subtypes that we've created, and within those cards, we should be able to see the prompt that we've created to use with that agent going forward. This might have to pull from agents.md; I'm not sure exactly how OpenClaw sets it up. But also within this page, we should have a "Create an Agent" button. Within that view, a user should be able to drop files, write text, input whatever else, decide on specific model types from a drop-down menu, and make any kind of determinations necessary for how you might set up a sub-agent going forward. The idea will be these kinds of agent profiles will exist in perpetuity on the machine, and whenever I create a task, I can assign it an agent profile from this page. So a coding agent that I've decided uses codecs and follows certain development protocols will be implemented for any task that I decide. Same for UI agent, or whatever other kind of working type of agent that I'd like to add. Use Codex5.2 for implementing the plan.

tasks.title: Explore and brainstorm possibilities for a refactor of the Kanban board project
tasks.description: DO NOT IMPLEMENT OR CHANGE ANY CODE. JUST PREPARE A BRAINSTORMING DOCUMENT IN MARKDOWN. DO NOT IMPLEMENT ANY CODE. The Kanban dashboard is unstable, the UI doesn't refresh natively without being prompted, and the service generally doesn't seem to work consistently. Let's first explore the current structure of the application, identifying the entire stack, then brainstorm some alternatives, along with light exploration of how much work is involved in a refactor for each possible upgrade in the tech stack. This app only needs to work locally, but we could also host it on Vercel and lock it behind a password. It only needs to work on desktop, though later creating a Telegram app to manage the dashboard would be nice. For now just working on Mac desktop is good. My gut says this would be more stable and consistent as a React app, but maybe the instability is a result of how we're (OpenClaw / Mac) is serving data to the dashboard? Please explain in detail, and provide alternatives. Please also include a web search for how other users are managing tasks on their OpenClaw dashboards. DO NOT IMPLEMENT OR CHANGE ANY CODE. JUST PREPARE A BRAINSTORMING DOCUMENT IN MARKDOWN. DO NOT IMPLEMENT ANY CODE.
